Package org.blab.utils.net

Class BlockingSocketReader

java.lang.Object
org.blab.utils.net.BlockingSocketReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class BlockingSocketReader extends Object implements Runnable
The BlockingSocketChannel client that reads messages from the provided channel.

Can be run in a separate thread, in which case all read operations will be performed in background.

Implements a polling system in which the client reads messages in a special buffer from which you can poll them at your discretion.

  • Method Details

    • poll

      public List<byte[]> poll(long timeout) throws InterruptedException
      Retrieve all received messages since last fetch.

      If there are no messages, blocks until the provided timeout expires or until some message becomes available.

      Parameters:
      timeout - maximum message waiting time. Negative values are treated as infinity.
      Returns:
      List of messages retrieved since the last poll. May be empty.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the client does not running.
      BlockingSocketException - if the client was aborted due to fatal exception.
      InterruptedException - if the thread interrupted during timeout.

    • isReconnected

      public boolean isReconnected()

    • run

      public void run()
      Start reading loop.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the connection is not established.
